urls.title: Digital transitions in lifelong guidance: rethinking careers practitioner professionalism
urls.description: The current papers consist of diverse authored contributions from independent CareersNet guidance experts and contributors to Cedefop‚Äôs 2020 CareersNet meeting. Changing career guidance delivery and career learning contexts, responding to widespread labour market changes and digital transformation of services, lead to new challenges, developments, and opportunities. Papers focus on the broad theme of professionalising the career guidance workforce and the particular competences fit for the digital and wider societal context. Not all authors place direct focus on technology-related themes.

It's important to address inequality in training participation: low skilled and older adults most disadvantaged. Low-educated: 50% lower participation (in Greece, over 80% lower), older adults: 30% lower (GR over 60% lower).
Cedefop Exec Dir @JuergenSiebel at @MinDigitalGr debate https://t.co/FpWEGT1yca

Money alone is not the issue in upgrading #skills. We also need to build up- and #reskilling systems in ways that they cater to the needs of different people while taking into account business needs.

Cedefop Executive Director @JuergenSiebel at @MinDigitalGr debate https://t.co/CnNu3UbJ94

Cedefop research pre-Covid showed that almost half (46%) of European adults have low or outdated #skills. This requires up- and #reskilling at an unprecedented scale. We have to double the speed of training.

Cedefop Executive Director @JuergenSiebel at @MinDigitalGr debate https://t.co/yhEDKfIEIN

The pandemic has shown that low digital skills aren't compatible with virtual learning + work. It's more important than ever to ensure every adult has lifelong opportunities to update their skills to thrive in their career.
